data.title: Replace ChromeDriver integration tests main process Mocha tests
data.body:
This is a proof of concept of where I think we need to take our main process testing. There's a lot to do to get to ideal, and this PR doesn't do any of that... All we do is the minimal to instantiate an `AtomApplication` in our main process mocha suite and test the results of calling `openWithOptions` repeatedly.

The main reason we did this now is because this test was failing on CircleCI and blocking our build modernization effort and we didn't want to fight with the existing ChromeDriver test.

In the future, I'd like to have a single method on `AtomApplication` called `launch` that takes CLI arguments directly from our main script. We can integration test that method or mock out a method like `openWindow` that takes options to separate unit testing of CLI parsing from window open logic. The point is, the main process code is just JavaScript and we can test it just like we test anything else. If we reduce `main.js` to just calling `launch`, then we only need ChromeDriver coverage of our shell scripts that launch Atom.

/cc @maxbrunsfeld

data.title: Remove config option `editor.backUpBeforeSaving`
Complete Uninstall/Reinstall/Portable Disaster
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)? (Why is that even relevant to most of the issues here?)
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? (Well one of the red boxes mentioned below say that there is an issue reported already.)
### Description

Well, I ran AtomSetup.exe expecting to select how I wanted it installed and stuff, but no, everything was automatic. What I wanted was a portable install for my flashdrive to take to school. Instead I got a local install in AppData or whatever.

I decided to just play with it anyways and I started to install some JavaScript add-ons. While they were installing a breaker blew in my house (this may or may not be relevant). I started my computer back up and went to run Atom again with the icon (that happened to just be a plain icon, not the Atom logo, with the Atom label). Nothing happened, not even a process. So I went to start it manually and it worked, except there were some red boxes with errors saying it couldn't do stuff with the files in the ".atom" data folder.

I uninstalled, deleted the data folders (manually... -.-), and reinstalled. The red boxes were still there. Uninstalled again.

Then I Googled to see if there was even a portable version of Atom available. Apparently there is according to an issue and a PR here. I downloaded `atom-windows.zip` and extracted. When I ran the `atom.exe`, there the red boxes were once again. Everything also seemed to be in the same state as it was when I closed the last installation.
### Steps to Reproduce

(explained in description)

**Expected behavior:** I want a portable version of Atom on my flashdrive that doesn't have any connections to Windows (besides the usual requirements) and runs fine.

**Actual behavior:** Explained above.
### Versions

Latest stable, 1.9.8.
Windows 10 Pro 64 bit.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9919010/17577791/dbc8e304-5f4f-11e6-95f6-1eb7a0c4d05f.png)

data.title: Atom 1.9.8 crashes when trying to open 9.2MB XML file on OS X 10.11.6
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I am going to develop an English / Swedish diction for Android, so I downloaded 4 data files into a directory:
- http://folkets-lexikon.csc.kth.se/folkets/folkets_en_sv_public.xml
- http://folkets-lexikon.csc.kth.se/folkets/folkets_sv_en_public.xml
- http://folkets-lexikon.csc.kth.se/folkets/folkets_en_sv_public.xdxf
- http://folkets-lexikon.csc.kth.se/folkets/folkets_sv_en_public.xdxf

If I attempt to open `folkets_en_sv_public.xdxf`, atom will hang and crash.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Download all of the files above
2. Start atom in safe mode
3. Open `folkets_en_sv_public.xdxf`

**Expected behavior:** 

Editor renders XML

**Actual behavior:** 

atom hangs, and then crashes
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

_atom versions_

```
Atom    : 1.9.8
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
```

**apm versions**

```
apm  1.10.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.6.4
```

**os versions**

```
Darwin Barrys-MBP 15.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 15.6.0: Thu Jun 23 18:25:34 PDT 2016; root:xnu-3248.60.10~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64
```

data.title: Workspace::scan with paths option causes ignored paths to be included
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)? (new spec tests fails with apm test)
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

When calling Workspace::scan with the `paths` option set, any ignored paths due to `core.excludeVcsIgnoredPaths` or `core.ignoredNames` are not ignored.

This was originally reported in atom/find-and-replace#621, and seems to be a problem with Workspace::scan.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Merge my PR with additional specs (see below)
2. Unskip the new tests (xit -> it)
3. Run `apm test` and observe the failures

**Expected behavior:** Tests pass - ignored paths are correctly ignored when the `paths` option is set.

**Actual behavior:** Tests fail - ignored paths are not ignored when the `paths` option is set.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.9.4
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
OS : Ubuntu 16.04

data.title: loading cursor symbol in i3wm because there is no startup-notification for atom
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?

- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

if you use atom in i3wm and exit it, you will always see a mouse symbol for waiting/loading because atom does not use the startup-notification?! https://faq.i3wm.org/question/118/mouse-cursor-remains-waiting-after-closing-last-tile.1.html
### Steps to Reproduce
1. start Atom in i3wm
2. exit it via your i3 shortcut for exiting programs (standard should be mod+shift+q)
3. see a loading/waiting mouse cursor

**Expected behavior:** normal mouse pointer

**Actual behavior:** loading/waiting mouse curser
### Versions

using atom 1.9.0 on fedora 24 with i3wm

data.title: Cannot open Atom from Applications dir on OS X El Capitan
data.body:
### Description

I'm using a MAC with **El Capitan**

I can not open Atom if I move it to **Applications** directory but it perfectly works if I open atom in other directory, Downloads for example.

For now I'm launching Atom from downloads Dir.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to [https://atom.io](https://atom.io) and download the latest version
2. Once downloaded, move Atom to Applications directory
3. Try to open it from Application directory
4. Enjoy the **“Atom” is broken and cannot be opened** message

**Expected behavior:**  Get Atom works from Applications directory

**Actual behavior:** Sends "Cannot open Atom" message 
### Versions

Atom version: **1,9,7**

### Description

When attempting to split panes by using the application's menu I end up with empty panes.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a file 
2. Open the View > Panes menu and select one of the Split Left/Right/Up/Down options

**Expected behavior:**

A new pane is created containing a new view of the currently open file.

**Actual behavior:**

A new pane is created but it is empty.
### Versions

Atom 1.9.7, OSX 10.9.5 and Ubuntu 15.04.

data.title: jump with a comment
data.body:
### Steps to Reproduce

 [First Step]

open a php file

``` php
<?php

namespace App\Jobs;

use Illuminate\Bus\Queueable;

abstract class Job
{
    /*
    |--------------------------------------------------------------------------
    | Queueable Jobs
    |--------------------------------------------------------------------------
    |
    | This job base class provides a central location to place any logic that
    | is shared across all of your jobs. The trait included with the class
    | provides access to the "onQueue" and "delay" queue helper methods.
    |
    */

    use Queueable;
}
```

[Second Step]
press Ctrl+R want  jump into a function
 [and so on...]
displayed content　is:

``` php
/*-----------
/ Job
/ Line:7
/-----------
/ providers
/ Line:14
/-----------*/
```

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
no data displayed or only class name displayed

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
a comment displayed

``` php
/*-----------
/  providers
/  Line:14
/-----------*/
```
### Versions

atom 1.9.7

data.title: 1.9.0: M+ font rendering
data.body:
Version 1.9.0 of Atom has introduced some nasty regression with font rendering:
![screenshot - 10 08 2016 - 12 10 21](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12006295/17548522/f21a657a-5ef4-11e6-88d6-f46ea1814b4a.png)
![screenshot - 10 08 2016 - 12 06 36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12006295/17548527/f4ebe422-5ef4-11e6-9426-bca2a8f79d63.png)
Take a look at "offset": despite using monospace font (it's M+ 1mn, size 17), letters 'f' are sticked to each other and occupy 1 space instead of two.
I cannot reproduce it on Liberation Sans Mono or DejaVu Sans Mono, only M+ (https://mplus-fonts.osdn.jp). Downgrading to 1.8.0 solves this, thus running in Safe mode (or with erased configs) makes no sense. Atom 1.9.7 also contains this bug.

Xubuntu 14.04.5 64-bit.

data.title: Add shell commands to Bash on Ubuntu on Windows
data.body:
### Description

The Atom Shell commands are not available on Bash on Ubuntu on Windows 10
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open [Bash on Ubuntu on Windows](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/commandline/wsl/about) in Windows 10
2. Try the `atom` and `apm` commands and note the "command not found" message
3. Try these same commands in Command Prompt (cmd.exe) and observe intended result

**Expected behavior:** Expected `atom` command to launch editor GUI and `apm` command to return `apm - Atom Package Manager powered by https://atom.io...` or install package named in command.

**Actual behavior:** Bash gives: `atom: command not found` and `apm: command not found`
### Versions

Atom    : 1.9.7
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
Windows 10 Home, Version 1607, OS Build 14393.10

data.title: Fix issues with getting environment variables from the shell
data.body: Refs https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12196

data.title: Stringify/parse temporary window state to avoid nulling out references
Add prevent option to ::onWillDestroyPaneItem()
data.body:
Might be useful as a reference: [::onWillDestroyPaneItem() documentation](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.9.7/Workspace#instance-onWillDestroyPaneItem)

**Steps which explain the enhancement**

``` coffeescript
atom.workspace.onWillDestroyPaneItem (event) =>
    event.prevent()
```
1. Call `.prevent()` on the event given as argument to the callback function in `::onWillDestroyPaneItem`.
2. `.prevent()` can toggle a boolean variable on the `.item`, letting the system know it should not be closed.
3. Instead of closing the pane item, the boolean variable will be toggled back.

**Current and suggested behavior**

Currently there is no way to prevent closing a tab via the JavaScript of a package. But a user of my package [pinned-tabs](https://github.com/ericcornelissen/pinned-tabs-for-atom) suggested [a feature](https://github.com/ericcornelissen/pinned-tabs-for-atom/issues/20) that requires this functionality. All this suggestion should really add is a way to prevent closing a tab when Atom reached the 'WillDestroy' state.

**Why would the enhancement be useful to most users**

It will mostly be useful for people that want to create a package that in one way or another have 'priority' tabs that they don't want to be closed when for example the close-all-tabs command is fired.

**Atom Version:** 1.9.7
**OS and Version:** Windows 10

data.title: Trigger grammar-used hooks no matter how text editors are created
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12333

data.title: AltGr is not Alt
data.body:
Hello,

it might only be a problem of a de-de keyboard but if I can not press AltGr+ß then I can not get a \. You need \ for namespaces in PHP. There is no easy way to deactivate alt--keybinding. I've read the CSON manual but couldn't find a clue how to do "nothing" on a keybinding.
For me Atom is useless unless this is not solved.

data.title: Update Windows build instructions to refer to Command Prompt more
data.body:
Despite the instructions saying that all the commands assumed the usage of Bash, it was actually the other way around - all commands used cmd syntax.  Other than clarifying that, I've also simplified/streamlined some of the sections.

There is one unfortunate "bug" introduced by these changes: whichever language package is being used by Linguist to highlight `cmd` blocks doesn't differentiate between when `dir` is being used as a command or as an argument.

``` cmd
script\build --install-dir
```

compared to

``` cmd
dir
```

/cc @damieng

data.title: Transpile exports/**/*.js when running script/build
data.body:
This fixes a regression introduced in #12350 that was preventing Atom from starting after running `script/build`. Specifically, we were still transpiling coffee script files located in the `exports` directory, ignoring all the javascript assets inside of it, thereby causing the output application to not contain the Atom exports file and to throw an exception on startup. To fix this, we have replaced coffee script transpilation with babel transpilation for `export/**/*.js` files.

/cc: @maxbrunsfeld @mnquintana @CraZySacX

data.title: Using CTRL+CMD+Down Arrow to move code down results in an error sound
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Using CTRL+CMD+Down Arrow to move selected code down results in an error sound. These's no sound when moving code up. I don't think there should be a sound.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Select a line of code.
2. Press CTRL+CMD+Down Arrow to move the selected code down.

**Expected behavior:**

There is no error sound.

**Actual behavior:**

There is an error sound.
### Versions

1.9.4

data.title: install packages in window system，not work
data.body:
in my window notebook。Everytime install package ，i must manually install，like ：

installed atom-jade for instance.

```
cd ~

cd .atom/packages

git clone https://github.com/merrihew/atom-jade.git

cd atom-jade

npm install

```

how to work it automatically ？

data.title: Crash on quit on OS X 10.11.6
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Crash. See attached log: **[atom.crash.zip](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/408119/atom.crash.zip)**
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Check for updates
2. Choose to install and restart

**Expected behavior:** Just restart, no funny business

**Actual behavior:** Crash.

Also, for some reason `/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Frameworks/Electron Framework.framework/Versions/A/Resources/crashpad_handler` wants to connect to `54.249.141.255` on port `1127`. I'm guessing this is an automatic crash reporter. However, the odd port number (not being 443 as it should be), made me prevent this outgoing connection.
### Versions

I believe all starting with 1.9 have done this.

data.title: Add assertions and additional metadata to investigate invalid iterator error
data.body: Refs #12085

data.title: Maximizing window requires several attempts
data.body:
Has anyone else encountered this situation?  I can't find any information about it.  Problem occurs on a fresh install or in safe mode.
### Description

Maximizing window requires several attempts.
### Steps to Reproduce

1) Open program, or switch to actively-running program.
1b) If program window is already maximized, reduce the window size below maximum.
2) Attempt to maximize window.
3) Attempt to maximize window.
4) Attempt to etc.

**Expected behavior:** Window is maximized after clicking "maximize window" button (or keyboard shortcut) once.

**Actual behavior:** Window requires multiple attempts at maximizing.  See gif of attempt(s) at [http://imgur.com/a/Ymzjo](http://imgur.com/a/Ymzjo)
### Versions

```C:\WINDOWS\system32>atom --version

Atom    : 1.9.6
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

C:\WINDOWS\system32>ver

Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.14393]

```
```
